content.description: A fun little route. The rock's a bit different than you'd find at the rest of the Shield. Fun patina-like edges and some pockets/horizontals. A good warmup.
content.protection: Take draws. Rap bolts on top.
content.location: Just before the main approach trail hits the cliff base, look for a small spur trail shooting off left. Follow this into the forest and to the base.

content.description: No distinct crux on this awesome climb (at least I didn't think so). If you enjoy burning calves and limestone pinching, this one's for you. Nice and sustained.
content.protection: Draws, 2-bolt anchor. The first bolt hanger sometimes spins.
content.location: First bolted line right of Hoist. Petzl Logic is just right of a large crack feature that goes at 5.8 on trad gear.

content.description: Climb featured and somewhat polished limestone on the right side of the face with Thousand Cranes. The climbing is reasonably sustained and has fun movement with some neat pockets and edges. Shares 2-bolt anchor with Thousand Cranes.
content.location: This is the next route right of Thousand Cranes, starting 10 feet right of where the approach trail meets the cliff.

content.description: Another fun little route with a devious sequence. Reminiscent of climbing at Blacktail Butte. Interesting, small holds.
content.protection: Take draws for a few bolts. Anchors on top.
content.location: Hoist is the leftmost sport climb on the Hoback Shield (not including Shady Grove). Start 10' up on a small ledge.

content.description:
A polished slabby limestone sport route. Fun movement, interesting variety of holds. Contender for the greasiest sport route in Jackson.

Guidebook is out of print, but this climb used to be rated 5.9 until its holds became so polished that was upgraded to 5.10a!
content.location: Just right of Petzl Logic, pretty much right where the main approach trail hits the wall.
